intro: Stanleya canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf penstemon, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces tall spikes of tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Stanleya canescens is adapted to cold climates and is a member of the Plantaginaceae family.
